component-types.description: This connector component invokes HTTP endpoints (tyically REST enpoints) and sets the result to the connector data. This connector can be used as data source for other components.
This connector component binds its data to a cookie. This connector can be used as data source for other components.

This connector component makes its data persistent by serializing it into the Local Storage of the current browser, in the given key. It also provides synchronization capabilities so that the data can be available accros several devices and shared between several users. This connector can be used as data source for other components.

A data mapper is a component that maps the data of a source component to its own data, applying some transformation(s) to it (typically filter/map/reduce). This connector can be used as data source for other components.

This connector component uses the geolocation API to provide the current user's location in its data. It also support connection to the Nominatim geocoding API, to resolve postal adresses as latitude/longitude coordinates.
This component displays a text to the user, with several formatting option available. The text can include HTML elements.
This component defines a user input for a true or false value, and displayed as a checkbox or a switch.
This component defines a user input to select one or multiple values within a list of data.
This component defines a user input for sereval kinds of data.
This component is a text area form input, for multiple-line text.
This component displays a button with a text and an optional icon and can execute actions when clicked.
This component displays an image located at a given URL.
This component displays a builtin icon from its name.
This component contains other components and can be used to layout them in different ways.

A reference component allows to insert another component in place of the reference. Several references can refer to the same component, making it convenient to factorize a component and repeat it in serveral places of your application.
This component splits the parent container in 2 parts. The split can be horizontal or vertical. It also provides support for resizable split and default sizes.
This component also showing information (title, body, image, ...) in a so-called card.
This component loops over an array of data in the data source, and repeats a content passing the currently iterated data.
Create a widget of tabbable containes, allowing the user to interactively switch between different containers by clicking on the tabs.
Easily toggle visibility of almost any content on your pages in a vertically collapsing container.
Dialogs are used to popup or prompt information to the user. The dialog content may contain any component.
This component displays tabular data. It supports pagination, filtering, sorting, custom cell components, and various style options.
This component displays various types of charts (line charts, bar charts, pie charts, radar charts). It is a wrapper of the well-known ChartJS library.
This component is a specific chart that is made to display time series data.
Lightweight custom tagged input form control, with options for customized interface rendering, duplicate tag detection and optional tag validation.
The Popover feature, provides a tooltip-like behavior, with fully customizable container content.
BootstrapVue custom date picker input form control.
BootstrapVue custom time picker input form control,
Quick first, previous, next, last, and page buttons for pagination control of an iterable component (a table or an iterator).
Avatar components are typically used to display a user profile as a picture, an icon, or short text.
A component to embed media content (video, audio, image), or external web sites.
A component to embed a map. It supports the Leaflet and OpenStreetMap API.
The carousel is a slideshow for cycling through a series of content. It works with a series of images, text, or custom markup. It also includes support for previous/next controls and indicators.
A custom progress component for displaying simple or complex progress bars, featuring support for horizontally stacked bars, animated backgrounds, and text labels.
The main navbar component for the application. Contains menus, custom components, user management support, route management support, and various global functions for the application.
A component to show PDF documents embedded in the app.
A component to open the device camera (if available) and take pictures.
A component to present some content in a sidebar, which can be shown and hidden depending on the needs.

HttpConnector.description: A function to handle http errors: (errorStatus, url, initializationObject) => { ... }
Select the type of result expected when invoking the endpoint (default is JSON, parsed to an object)
If unspecified, defaults to comma (English standard)
Use a proxy (to be used to allow CORS when accessing REST APIs)
Cache the invocation results in the local storage when possible
The number of minutes before a cache key expires (when not defined, default is 24 hours)

The maximum number of entries in the cache (each entry corresponds to a set of specific parameter values), default is 100. Note that cache eviction takes place when the number of entries reaches the max number of entries and frees 10% of the cache.
LRU: Least Recently Used, LFU: Least Frequently Used

The path to the http endpoint. When using the invoke(...params) action on this component, you can access invocation parameters with the this.invokeParams variable (for instance: x/y/${this.invokeParams[0]}/z)
Sends the body as a form data instead of serialized JSON (default)
Specifies how the body should be sent (default is serialized JSON). FORM-DATA sends the body as form data. TEXT sends the body as is.
A JSON object containing the headers to be added to the request.

An object containing the body of the request. However, when the selected body type is raw-text, you should write a formula that evaluates to a string. When using the invoke(...params) action on this component, you can access invocation parameters with the this.invokeParams variable (for instance: { key: ${this.invokeParams[0]} })

CookieConnector.description: A string representing the name of the cookie. If omitted, this is empty by default.
The default value of the data model when the cookie does not exist yet or when its value is not valid.
A date or a number that represents the expiration date of the cookie as the number of seconds since the UNIX epoch. If omitted, the cookie becomes a session cookie.
A cookies.SameSiteStatus value that indicates the SameSite state of the cookie. If omitted, it defaults to no_restriction.

LocalStorageConnector.description: The id field name (default is "id")

If set, this connector is a query to the local storage (read-only data access). Keys and shared by expressions can be regexp to match existing storage keys - when several keys are matched, the data is merged into a unique collection.
If set, this connector automatically synchronizes before and after each data change.
If set, this connector automatically injects IDs to the data objects.
If set, this connector automatically injects timestamps to the data objects.
If set, the data is persited in the application model.
A string representing key used to store the data in the local storage
A user ID - the given user must share the key with you to have access
A list of user ids to share this data with (read/write permissions). For partitioned data, can be a function returning a list of user ids: (id, data) => ...
A list of user ids to share this data with (read-only permission). For partitioned data, can be a function returning a list of user ids: (id, data) => ...
If a partition key is defined, the data, which is an array, will be partitioned in several sub-keys (main-key::partition-key), which can be shared and synchronized independently
If set, the storage is only remote (on the server) and no data is stored locally in the browser - the user must be authenticated
The default value of the data model when the data does not exist yet in the local storage or when its value is not valid

DataMapper.description: A functional expression that maps (transforms, filters, sorts, reduces, ...) the data from the data source to the data model. For instance: data => data.filter(d => d.category === "c")

GeolocConnector.description: A boolean value that indicates the application would like to receive the best possible results. If true and if the device is able to provide a more accurate position, it will do so. Note that this can result in slower response times or increased power consumption (with a GPS chip on a mobile device for example). On the other hand, if false, the device can take the liberty to save resources by responding more quickly and/or using less power. Default: false.

A positive long value representing the maximum length of time (in milliseconds) the device is allowed to take in order to return a position. The default value is Infinity, meaning that getCurrentPosition() won't return until the position is available.

A positive long value indicating the maximum age in milliseconds of a possible cached position that is acceptable to return. If set to 0, it means that the device cannot use a cached position and must attempt to retrieve the real current position. If set to Infinity the device must return a cached position regardless of its age. Default: 0.

A value evaluating to true is required for this control to have a valid state

possibleValues.text: "symbol" to use a localized currency symbol such as , this is the default value
"narrowSymbol" to use a narrow format symbol ("$100" rather than "US$100")
"code" to use the ISO currency code
"name" to use a localized currency name such as "dollar"

InputView.description: In many locales, accounting format means to wrap the number with parentheses instead of appending a minus sign. Check this to enable this formatting.

possibleValues.text: "engineering" - exponent of ten when divisible by three
"compact" - string representing exponent; defaults to using the "short" form
"auto" sign display for negative numbers only
"exceptZero" sign display for positive and negative numbers, but not zero
"negative" sign display for negative numbers only, excluding negative zero.
"always": display grouping separators even if the locale prefers otherwise
"auto": display grouping separators based on the locale preference, which may also be dependent on the currency
"min2": display grouping separators when there are at least 2 digits in a group
"halfEven": ties toward the value with even cardinality

InputView.description: The minimum number of integer digits to use. Possible values are from 1 to 21; the default is 1.

The minimum number of fraction digits to use. Possible values are from 0 to 20; the default for plain number and percent formatting is 0; the default for currency formatting is the number of minor unit digits provided by the ISO 4217 currency code list (2 if the list doesn't provide that information).

The maximum number of fraction digits to use. Possible values are from 0 to 20; the default for plain number formatting is the larger of minimumFractionDigits and 3; the default for currency formatting is the larger of minimumFractionDigits and the number of minor unit digits provided by the ISO 4217 currency code list (2 if the list doesn't provide that information); the default for percent formatting is the larger of minimumFractionDigits and 0.
The minimum number of significant digits to use. Possible values are from 1 to 21; the default is 1.
The maximum number of significant digits to use. Possible values are from 1 to 21; the default is 21.
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

A text that shows as a popover when hovering the button

cylon: slides the icon left-right, cylon-vertical: slides the icon up-down, fade: fades the icon in and out, spin: smoothly spins the icon clockwise, spin-reverse: smoothly spins the icon counter-clockwise, spin-pulse: spins the icon clockwise, but in a pulsed step style, spin-reverse-pulse: spins the icon counter-clockwise, but in a pulsed step style, throb: scales the icon in and out

Allow the user to interactively select a new icon and sets the data with it

cylon: slides the icon left-right, cylon-vertical: slides the icon up-down, fade: fades the icon in and out, spin: smoothly spins the icon clockwise, spin-reverse: smoothly spins the icon counter-clockwise, spin-pulse: spins the icon clockwise, but in a pulsed step style, spin-reverse-pulse: spins the icon counter-clockwise, but in a pulsed step style, throb: scales the icon in and out

ContainerView.description: The title of the container
Makes this container a stepper, meaning that each component will be shown individually and that you can use the next(), previous(), and goto(index) actions to navigate within the components.
Transition animations for the stepper.
The duration of the transition animations for the stepper (in ms).

CSS classes to apply to the items of this container. This fomula can be a function taking the item index, col, and row arguments for a grid layout, for example: (index, row, col) => row === 0 ? "text-bold" : undefined

CSS to apply to the items of this container. This fomula can be a function taking the item index, col, and row arguments for a grid layout, for example: (index, row, col) => row === 0 ? "font-size: 0.8rem" : undefined
A size for the background image (default is cover)
A minimum width for the columns (as a CSS width)
Sets the initial position of the background image (default is center)
An image to be used for the background of this container. Can be a css gradient, e.g.: linear-gradient(red, blue 10%)
An opacity factor to apply to the background variant (if background variant is defined)
If enabled, this container acts as a form and reacts on @submit and @reset events
If enabled, all contained controls show their state as soon as the user inputs a new value
When set, enables browser native HTML5 validation on controls in the form
Stretch vertically to fill the parent component height
Default is no-padding - other values correspond to the boostrap classes (see the doc)

Default is flex. For left-to-right items layout and fixed number of columns, use the grid kind. For top-down items layout, use the column kind. Use list-group to place the items into a vertical list group
Listen to keyboard events.
Tells how to align the items of this container when the flex layout kind is selected. Default is column.

Tells the wrap behavior when the components overflow the flex container width.
  • nowrap (default): all flex items will be on one line.
  • wrap: flex items will wrap onto multiple lines, from top to bottom.
  • wrap-reverse: flex items will wrap onto multiple lines from bottom to top.

This defines the flex container alignment along the main axis. It helps distribute extra free space leftover when either all the flex items on a line are inflexible, or are flexible but have reached their maximum size. It also exerts some control over the alignment of items when they overflow the line.
  • start (default): items are packed toward the start of the flex direction.
  • end: items are packed toward the end of the flex direction.
  • start: items are packed toward the start of the writing-mode direction.
  • center: items are centered along the line
  • space-between: items are evenly distributed in the line; first item is on the start line, last item on the end line
  • space-around: items are evenly distributed in the line with equal space around them. Note that visually the spaces arent equal, since all the items have equal space on both sides. The first item will have one unit of space against the container edge, but two units of space between the next item because that next item has its own spacing that applies.
  • space-evenly: items are distributed so that the spacing between any two items (and the space to the edges) is equal.

This defines the default behavior for how flex items are laid out along the cross axis on the current line.
  • stretch (default): stretch to fill the container (still respect min-width/max-width)
  • start: items are placed at the start of the cross axis. The difference between these is subtle, and is about respecting the flex-direction rules or the writing-mode rules.
  • end: items are placed at the end of the cross axis. The difference again is subtle and is about respecting flex-direction rules vs. writing-mode rules.
  • center: items are centered in the cross-axis
  • baseline: items are aligned such as their baselines align

This aligns a flex container's lines within when there is extra space in the cross-axis, similar to how justify aligns individual items within the main-axis.
  • normal (default): items are packed in their default position as if no value was set.
  • stretch: lines stretch to take up the remaining space
  • start: items packed to the start of the container.
  • end: items packed to the end of the container.
  • center: items centered in the container
  • space-between: items evenly distributed; the first line is at the start of the container while the last one is at the end
  • space-around: items evenly distributed with equal space around each line
  • space-evenly: items are evenly distributed with equal space around them
When checked, all child components inside this container get lazy loaded when appearing on the screen. Note that before they appear, lazy-loaded components cannot be accessed by other components.
A CSS width for this container child components before they get lazy loaded
A CSS height for this container child components before they get lazy loaded
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

tools-documentation.name: arrayConcat
tools-documentation.description: Concatenates arrayOrItem at the end of the given array.

tools-documentation.name: arrayMove
tools-documentation.description: Moves an item within an array.

tools-documentation.name: collectUniqueFieldValues
tools-documentation.description: Returns a list of values that correspond to the values found in the fieldName properties of the items.

tools-documentation.name: range
tools-documentation.description: Creates an array with integer values between start and end.

tools-documentation.name: characterRange
tools-documentation.description: Creates an array with characters between startChar and endChar.

tools-documentation.name: series
tools-documentation.usage: $tools.series(initialData, nextFunction: (data, series, index) => data, size = undefined)
tools-documentation.description: Generates a series of data from initialData and a nextFunction. The nextFunction takes the current data and should return the next data in the series. If the returned value is undefined, the series ends.

tools-documentation.name: paginate
tools-documentation.description: Returns an array containes slices/pages of the given array and of the given length. For instance, $tools.paginate([1, 2, 3, 4, 5], 2) returns [[1, 2], [3, 4], [5]].

tools-documentation.name: defaultColor
tools-documentation.description: Gets the default color at the given index.

tools-documentation.name: isValidColor
tools-documentation.description: Returns true if the given color object is valid.

tools-documentation.name: hexToRgb
tools-documentation.description: Transforms a hex-color string to its rgb array representation.

tools-documentation.name: rgbToHex
tools-documentation.description: Tansforms a rgb array to an hex-color string.

tools-documentation.name: normalizeHex
tools-documentation.description: Normalizes the hex-color string.

tools-documentation.name: colorGradientHex
tools-documentation.description: Creates a color gradient from 2 colors.

tools-documentation.name: mixColors
tools-documentation.description: Mixes two colors A and B to return a color between A and B according to the amountToMix (a value beeteen 1 and 0, the closer to 1, the closer to A).

tools-documentation.name: isDarkColor
tools-documentation.description: Tells if the given color is more dark than light. Color can be in a CSS, hex, or RGB array format

tools-documentation.name: camelToKebabCase
tools-documentation.description: Converts a camel-case string to a kebab-case string. For instance abcDef converts to abc-def.

tools-documentation.name: camelToSnakeCase
tools-documentation.description: Converts a camel-case string to a snake-case string. For instance abcDef converts to abc_def.

tools-documentation.name: camelToLabelText
tools-documentation.description: Converts a camel-case string to a label-case string. For instance abcDef converts to abc def.

tools-documentation.name: kebabToCamelCase
tools-documentation.description: Converts a kebab-case string to a camel-case string. For instance abc-def converts to abcDef.

tools-documentation.name: kebabToLabelText
tools-documentation.description: Converts a kebab-case string to a label-case string. For instance abc-def converts to abc def.

tools-documentation.name: snakeToCamelCase
tools-documentation.description: Converts a snake-case string to a camel-case string. For instance abc_def converts to abcDef.

tools-documentation.name: snakeToLabelText
tools-documentation.description: Converts a snake-case string to a label-case string. For instance abc_def converts to abc def.

tools-documentation.name: markdownToHtml
tools-documentation.description: Converts a markdown string to html. For instance # My Title converts to <h1>My Title</h1>.

tools-documentation.name: toLabelText
tools-documentation.description: Converts a string to a label string.

tools-documentation.name: csvToArray
tools-documentation.description: Converts a CSV-formatted text to an array of objects.

tools-documentation.name: arrayToCsv
tools-documentation.description: Converts an array of objects to CSV-formatted text.

tools-documentation.name: convertImage
tools-documentation.description: Converts an image to another image according to the given conversion parameters.

tools-documentation.name: convertImageData
tools-documentation.description: Converts an image to another image according to the given conversion parameters (quality = 0.5, maxWidth = 800, outputMimeType = 'image/jpg', width, height).

tools-documentation.name: xmlToJson
tools-documentation.description: Parses an XML string and converts it to a JSON object. Options are parsing options as defined here

tools-documentation.name: isValidDate
tools-documentation.description: Returns true if the given date parameter is a valid date.

tools-documentation.name: now
tools-documentation.description: Returns the current date.

tools-documentation.name: date
tools-documentation.description: Returns a date from a string/object.

tools-documentation.name: datetime
tools-documentation.description: Returns a datetime from a string/object.

tools-documentation.name: time
tools-documentation.description: Returns a time from a string/object.

tools-documentation.name: dateRange
tools-documentation.description: Returns an array of date objects between dateStart and dateEnd, with stepKind = 'SECOND' | 'MINUTE' | 'HOUR' | 'DAY' | 'MONTH' | 'YEAR'.

tools-documentation.name: diffBusinessDays
tools-documentation.description: Returns the number of business days between two dates

tools-documentation.name: loadScript
tools-documentation.description: Loads a Javascript file from a URL - returns a promise

tools-documentation.name: loadStyleSheet
tools-documentation.description: Loads a CSS file from a URL - returns a promise

tools-documentation.name: deleteCookie
tools-documentation.description: Deletes cookie.

tools-documentation.name: getCookie
tools-documentation.description: Gets cookie.

tools-documentation.name: setCookie
tools-documentation.description: Sets cookie.

tools-documentation.name: download
tools-documentation.description: Downloads the given data as a local file.

tools-documentation.name: upload
tools-documentation.usage: $tools.[DEPRECATED] upload(callback, resultType = 'text', maxSize = 10*1024, sizeExceededCallback = undefined, conversionOptions = undefined)
tools-documentation.description: Uploads a file choosen locally by the user (resultType may be 'file', 'text' (default), or 'json'). When the upload is finished, the callback function is called whith te uploaded data as a parameter.

tools-documentation.name: uploadFile
tools-documentation.description: Uploads a file choosen locally by the user (resultType may be 'file', 'text' (default), 'data', or 'json'). Use 'data' for images. When the upload is finished, the promise is resolved with the loaded data or file (if 'file' is specified). For an image, conversionOptions can be set to automatically convert the image (possibly reducing its size).

tools-documentation.name: linkify
tools-documentation.description: Looks for all the URLs in a text and wrap them with HTML links. For instance, 'https//abc.com' will be converted to '<a href="https//abc.com">https//abc.com</a>'.

tools-documentation.name: validateEmail
tools-documentation.description: Returns true if the given email parameter is a valid email.

tools-documentation.name: isValidEmail
tools-documentation.description: Returns true if the given email parameter is a valid email.

tools-documentation.name: isNotEmpty
tools-documentation.description: Returns true if the given string parameter is not empty or undefined/null.

tools-documentation.name: toHex
tools-documentation.description: Converts a number to its hexadecimal representation. The padding parameters tells the number of digits.

tools-documentation.name: truncate
tools-documentation.description: Truncates the given string so that it does not exceed the given size.

tools-documentation.name: capitalize
tools-documentation.description: Capitalizes the given string. If allLetters is false, only the first letter is capitalized, otherwise the whole word.

tools-documentation.name: normalize
tools-documentation.description: Removes all uppercase letters, accents and special caracters so that normalized strings can be compared with 'lazy' matching.

tools-documentation.name: toast
tools-documentation.description: Shows a toast to the user with given title and message. The variant is the Bootstrap variant. The toaster parameter defines the toast layout.

tools-documentation.name: icon
tools-documentation.description: Creates an SVG icon available in BootstrapVue icons.

tools-documentation.name: getCurrentLocale
tools-documentation.description: Returns the current locale, as defined by the navigator, or selected by the user.

tools-documentation.name: countryFlag
tools-documentation.description: Gets the country flag character for the given locale.

tools-documentation.name: exitFullscreen
tools-documentation.description: Leaves fullscreen mode, after requested with $c(...).requestFullscreen()

tools-documentation.name: isFullscreen
tools-documentation.description: Tells if the application is in fullscreen mode, after requested with $c(...).requestFullscreen()

tools-documentation.name: showOverlay
tools-documentation.description: Shows a spinner overlay on the main area (typically to indicate some on-going work). If show is false, the overlay is hidden.

tools-documentation.name: alert
tools-documentation.description: Shows an alert modal.

tools-documentation.name: confirm
tools-documentation.description: Shows a confirm modal.

tools-documentation.name: prompt
tools-documentation.description: Shows a prompt modal.

tools-documentation.name: uuid
tools-documentation.description: Creates a unique ID.

tools-documentation.name: diffData
tools-documentation.description: Returns the list of data fields that have different values in data1 and data2.

HttpConnector.name: eval
HttpConnector.description: Evaluates the given Javascript expressions - should be separated with commas: expr1, expr2, expr3.

HttpConnector.name: setVisible
HttpConnector.description: Shows or hides the current component depending on the visible value. If data is defined, sets the data of the component while making it visible.

HttpConnector.name: toggleVisible
HttpConnector.description: Toggle component visibility. See setVisible

HttpConnector.name: show
HttpConnector.description: Makes the current component visible. If data is defined, sets the data of the component.

HttpConnector.name: hide
HttpConnector.description: Shows or hides the current component.

HttpConnector.name: scrollIntoView
HttpConnector.description: Scrolls the component to make it visible in the container.

HttpConnector.name: animate
HttpConnector.description: Applies an animation to the component.

HttpConnector.name: emit
HttpConnector.description: Emits an event.

HttpConnector.name: update
HttpConnector.description: Updates the data of this component, as defined by its data source.

HttpConnector.name: clear
HttpConnector.description: Clears by force the data of this component, even if the data source is not empty.

HttpConnector.name: reset
HttpConnector.description: Resets the components data to its default value.

HttpConnector.name: forceRender
HttpConnector.description: Forces the component to render again fully. Normaly this is not necessary to use because most data modification is reactive, however, in some specific cases it might be necessary.

HttpConnector.name: setData
HttpConnector.description: Sets the data of this component.

HttpConnector.name: downloadAsPDF
HttpConnector.description: Downloads a PDF-version of this component, as it renders currently on the screen.

HttpConnector.name: requestFullscreen
HttpConnector.description: Requests the browser to switch this component in full screen mode. Can be unswitched programatically with $tools.exitFullscreen()

HttpConnector.name: addData
HttpConnector.description: If the data model of this component is an array, adds the given data to it. It is better if the data contains a unique id field

HttpConnector.name: removeData
HttpConnector.description: If the data model of this component is an array, adds the given data to it. Data comparison is performed against the id field of the data, or by reference if the id field is undefined

HttpConnector.name: toggleData
HttpConnector.description: If the data model of this component is an array, adds (if not present yet) or removes (if present yet) the given data to it. Data comparison is performed against the id field of the data, or by reference if the id field is undefined

HttpConnector.name: replaceData
HttpConnector.description: If the data model of this component is an array, and the data is already found by id, replaces the found data with the given data. Data comparison is performed against the id field of the data, or by reference if the id field is undefined

HttpConnector.name: mergeData
HttpConnector.description: Merges an existing data with a new version. Data comparison is performed against the id field of the data, or by reference if the id field is undefined

HttpConnector.name: concatArray
HttpConnector.description: Adds an array of data to the existing array.

HttpConnector.name: setFieldData
HttpConnector.description: If the data model is an object, adds or updates a field named fieldName to this object, filled with the value given by data

HttpConnector.name: addCollectionData
HttpConnector.description: If the data model is an object, adds or updates a field named collectionName to this object, by adding data to the field, which is expected to contain an array

HttpConnector.name: removeCollectionData
HttpConnector.description: If the data model is an object, updates a field named collectionName to this object, by removing data from the field, which is expected to contain an array

CookieConnector.description: If the data model of this component is an array, adds (if not present yet) or removes (if present yet) the given data to it. Data comparison is performed against the id field of the data, or by reference if the id field is undefined

CookieConnector.name: replaceData
CookieConnector.description: If the data model of this component is an array, and the data is already found by id, replaces the found data with the given data. Data comparison is performed against the id field of the data, or by reference if the id field is undefined

CookieConnector.name: mergeData
CookieConnector.description: Merges an existing data with a new version. Data comparison is performed against the id field of the data, or by reference if the id field is undefined

CookieConnector.name: concatArray
CookieConnector.description: Adds an array of data to the existing array.

CookieConnector.name: setFieldData
CookieConnector.description: If the data model is an object, adds or updates a field named fieldName to this object, filled with the value given by data

CookieConnector.name: addCollectionData
CookieConnector.description: If the data model is an object, adds or updates a field named collectionName to this object, by adding data to the field, which is expected to contain an array

CookieConnector.name: removeCollectionData
CookieConnector.description: If the data model is an object, updates a field named collectionName to this object, by removing data from the field, which is expected to contain an array

ProgressView.name: toggleData
ProgressView.description: If the data model of this component is an array, adds (if not present yet) or removes (if present yet) the given data to it. Data comparison is performed against the id field of the data, or by reference if the id field is undefined

ProgressView.name: replaceData
ProgressView.description: If the data model of this component is an array, and the data is already found by id, replaces the found data with the given data. Data comparison is performed against the id field of the data, or by reference if the id field is undefined

ProgressView.name: mergeData
ProgressView.description: Merges an existing data with a new version. Data comparison is performed against the id field of the data, or by reference if the id field is undefined

ProgressView.name: concatArray
ProgressView.description: Adds an array of data to the existing array.

ProgressView.name: setFieldData
ProgressView.description: If the data model is an object, adds or updates a field named fieldName to this object, filled with the value given by data

ProgressView.name: addCollectionData
ProgressView.description: If the data model is an object, adds or updates a field named collectionName to this object, by adding data to the field, which is expected to contain an array

ProgressView.name: removeCollectionData
ProgressView.description: If the data model is an object, updates a field named collectionName to this object, by removing data from the field, which is expected to contain an array

NavbarView.description: Programmatically overrides this navbar variant, defined in the variant property.

NavbarView.name: go
NavbarView.description: Goes to the given place, which can be a page (a pageId), an anchor/hash in the page (defined by a component), or a full route object. Routes can be the following. A path object: { path: '/users/eduardo' }. Named route with params to let the router build the url: { name: 'user', params: { username: 'eduardo' } }. With query, resulting in '/register?plan=private': { path: '/register', query: { plan: 'private' } }. With hash, resulting in '/about#team': { path: '/about', hash: '#team' }.

NavbarView.name: back
NavbarView.description: Goes back to the previous place in the navigation history.

NavbarView.name: forward
NavbarView.description: Goes to the next place in the navigation history (only if back was used before).

HttpConnector.name: isVisible
HttpConnector.description: Tells if this component is currently visible

HttpConnector.name: getElement
HttpConnector.description: Gets the HTML DOM element corresponding to this component

HttpConnector.name: getIteratorIndex
HttpConnector.description: Gets the iterator index of this component, if it is placed in an iterator

HttpConnector.name: getIteratorContext
HttpConnector.description: Gets the iterator context of this component, if it is placed in an iterator

HttpConnector.name: findChildren
HttpConnector.description: Recursively finds all the sub-components within this component, that match the given matcher. The matcher is either a function taking the view model to be matched as a parameter, either a string with the component type name (for instance "ButtonView" to find all the buttons)

HttpConnector.name: findParent
HttpConnector.description: Finds the first parent that matches the given matcher. The matcher is either a function taking the view model to be matched as a parameter, either a string with the component type name (for instance "ButtonView" to find all the buttons)

HttpConnector.name: getChildren
HttpConnector.description: Gets all the sub-components within this component, recursively

HttpConnector.name: getParent
HttpConnector.description: Gets the parent component of this component

HttpConnector.name: previous
HttpConnector.description: Gets the previous component (sibling) of this component if any. Only works if the current component is placed in a container

HttpConnector.name: next
HttpConnector.description: Gets the next component (sibling) of this component if any. Only works if the current component is placed in a container

HttpConnector.name: containsData
HttpConnector.description: Returns true if the component data model contains the given data. Data comparison is performed against the id field of the data, or by reference if the id field is undefined
